page.title: 01 LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: SAREHOLE MILL According to documentary evidence there has been a mill at Sarehole since 1542. The first known building to be erected on the site was a corn mill built by J. Bedell of Beoley. In 1727 the mill was bought by the Eaves family who rented it out. One of the tenants was Matthew Boulton who may have changed the mill to metal rolling. After Boulton's departure the mill was pulled down and monies raised by Eaves suggest that he rebuilt the mill between 1764-68. At this time he improved the water supply which fed the overshot wheel. Further money enabled Eaves to build a granary and blade grinding workshop. In the early 19th century the mill once again reverted to corn grinding. John Andrews took the tenancy in 1858. In 1919 milling totally ceased.
